intro: Limosella australis, commonly known as the Australian sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, and its leaves are alternate and linear. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal areas. Limosella australis is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
